page.title: 07Local Government - Cronton
page.content: {Local Government Established;}By Act of Elizabeth 1.Officers:Overseer of the Poor,Surveyor of the Highways and a Constable.Local Government Act of 1894 resulted in the Parish Clerk replacing the Overseer of the Poor and the Constable's and Surveyor's work transferred to Whiston R.D.C.{Cronton {Parish Council;}now consists of 10 Councillors,elected for a 4 years term of office.There are 9 Conservative and 1 Independant members.{Aims Of Parish {Council;}to work closely with the local community to review and improve the quality of village life.Recent business has included:improvements to the sewage system-with minimum disturbance,roads repair,water supply, speed limit and securing grants for the development of leisure facilities. {School Government;}The Parish Council are represented at both schools.
